Package jetbrains.exodus.bindings

Class ComparableBinding

  • java.lang.Object
    • jetbrains.exodus.bindings.ComparableBinding
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanBinding, ByteBinding, ComparableSetBinding, DoubleBinding, FloatBinding, IntegerBinding, LongBinding, ShortBinding, SignedDoubleBinding, SignedFloatBinding, StringBinding
    public abstract class ComparableBinding
extends java.lang.Object
    Bindings are used to represent comparable Java objects as ByteIterable. There are several inheritors of the ComparableBinding class, they allow to serialize a value of any Java primitive type or String to ArrayByteIterable, as well as to deserialize ByteIterable to a value. All the inheritors contain two static methods: one for getting ByteIterable entry from a value, and another for getting value from a ByteIterable entry.

    Bindings save natural order of values. This means that the greater the value, the greater the ByteIterable entry. The order of the ByteIterable entries is defined by Arrays.compareUnsigned(byte[], byte[]). The only exceptions are DoubleBinding and FloatBinding, they save order only for unsigned non-negative values.

    See Also:
    BooleanBinding, ByteBinding, ComparableSetBinding, DoubleBinding, SignedDoubleBinding, FloatBinding, SignedFloatBinding, IntegerBinding, LongBinding, ShortBinding, StringBinding, ByteIterable, ArrayByteIterable
